metadata.title: CVE-2022-1353 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in the pfkey_register function innet/key/af_key.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local,unprivileged user to gain access to kernel memory, leading to a systemcrash or a leak of internal kernel information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-189-generic - 4.15.0-189.200~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-189-generic - 4.15.0-189.200~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-189-lowlatency - 4.15.0-189.200~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-kvm - 4.4.0-1110.120
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1145-aws - 4.4.0-1145.160
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1137-aws - 4.15.0-1137.148~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-azure - 4.15.0-1146.161~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-gcp - 4.15.0-1131.147~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1102-oracle - 4.15.0-1102.113~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-189.200~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.120').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1145.160').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1137.148~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.161~16.04.1').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.147~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1102.113~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
